data.title: Sushi at its finest!
data.text:
Great place for Sushi, the inside presentation isn't much, but I come for the Sushi.
Make sure you look at all their Specials on the chalk board.

data.title: Just OK
data.text: Does not rate the highest of the sushi bars we have eaten at. Service was good, but the sushi roll I had was boring.

data.title: Walked in and walked out
data.text: Let me start by saying we have enjoyed eating here in the past, but I am not sure what was going on lately.  We walked in to the restaurant and were "hit" with a strong smell.  Something like a cross between old dishwater and old socks.  We sat down and the waitress proceeded to engage us with conversation about her personal life.  The place seemed dirty, too.  There was a little girl in the corner standing on a bench crying which we were told was employees child, unattended.  What a disappointment..  We could not stand the smell any longer, the waitress still had not shown up with drinks so we left.  Sorry guys, please clean up your place and wait staff.

data.title: Don't judge a book by it's cover!
data.text: We met some friends of ours here for dinner one night.  Doesn't look like much on the outside, or on the inside but the food was fantastic!  Waitstaff was very friendly and helpful with the menu and made sure everyone was satisfied throughout the meal.  Our friends had Sushi which looked great (although we don't particularly care for it, it was presented beautifully!) and we had the Thai Cashew Chicken which was so good!  We will definitely come again next time we visit the Cape.

data.title: The Sushi Was Very Good
data.text: The visit to Sans-Sushi was a spur of the moment decision due to a craving for sushi.  The place is lacking in ambience and decor, but the food was good and the cost was reasonable.  It's not a place to go for a special occasion, but we would return.

data.title: Food is great. But it ends there.
data.text:
I'd give this place a rating of 5 based on the soup, sushi and Pad Thai. However, the atmosphere is really sub-par and detracted greatly from the experience. Our menus were in tatters and barely hanging on to the spiral binding. The table was sticky and the waitress tried to convince me it wasn't. It took three wipe downs to get the table clean. While our waitress was taking our order, she was more interested in talking with her coworkers than actually taking our order. On top of that, either the owners or employees had their young kids there and there was lots of crying going on.... in the dining area. Very distracting.
If you want great sushi, call here and order it to go.

data.title: Great Thai food, great sushi
data.text:
Went on a Thursday evening during season. Sushi  chefs were WAY backed up but there were only a few customers there. Must be take out that backs things up.
Some of the best Thai food I have had, ever. The chicken Pad Thai was simply excellent and my wife's Panang Curry chicken just as good. In fact, these 2 dishes had to rank as the best I have had in Cape Coral/Ft Myers. The sushi dish my wife had was on par with everything else.
However, my miso soup could have been a LOT hotter as was my shrimp tempura. I guess being backed up on the sushi line equates to the chef being backed up in the kitchen. Regardless, once everything came out it was fantastic.
Aesthetics...as commented before the place needs some interior TLC. As a mom + pop local restaurant owner, my wife and I know that cleanliness and attention to detail can make or break a place. To the owners...please. please clean your a/c vents, change your filters and repair/update minor interior items. It REALLY makes a big difference! :-)
 On an ending note, we will be going back, probably for take out.

data.title: Great sushi,good presentation.
data.text: Service is good,but sometimes chefs get a little backed up on busy nights.Sushi is great,presentation wonderful,drinks are great,salads and miso soup are as good as you will find in this area.

data.title: Delicious, fresh sushi.
data.text: We ordered from Sans-Sushi for new years eve and the sushi was fresh and delicious. We would recommend this place and would return if ever in the area again!

data.title: Not impressed at all
data.text:
I know it's Christmas Eve and not everyone is looking forward to working but this time it really showed. We showed up at 8:51 PM and the place was not full. I counted 1 large group that was finishing up, another group of about 5 and then a few people at the sushi bar. We promptly made our order but it took over 20 minutes to even get our appetizer. We were already contemplating canceling our order and just paying for the drinks but the appetizer already showed up.

It's hard to explain but there was something not right about the food. It wasn't spoiled but something was a bit off. The sashimi was definitely not fresh. It wasn't even cold. It was room temperature. The rolls we ordered were covered in over sweetened sauce that took away from the freshness of the ingredients but the one thing I did notice was that the rice used for the rolls was over cooked and underprepared with the sushi vinegar. It was just "sticky rice" rolled into a roll.

Call me a sushi snob but this was far from the sushi and sashimi we have become used to from up in the northeast. We should've just cut our losses before the food came out. That was $70 and 1hr  that we'll never see again.

data.title: It was ok
data.text:
The service was fantastic.  They do have daily happy hour specials which include sake beer and wine.

It appears to be a family owned business and many locals  frequenting the place. 

The food was fantastic. I had the steak teriyaki which included soup and salad. The meal was very good and priced reasonably.

The interior could use a little fixing up and re-organized. The bathrooms were clean but the restaurant overall appear to be a little bit outdated.

I would definitely return to this place.

data.title: Great fresh sushi
data.text: I had a delicious lobster maki with so much extra lobster that was fresh and satisfiying. The selection and unique choices made my decision difficult but more reason to return and try more

data.title: Always a dependable place for great sushi/sashimi
data.text: Everytime i go here the food is prepared in a very pleasing manner, if you sit at the counter you can talk to the chefs, they do Hibachi style cooking as well as sushi and sushimi...always fresh and courteous..

data.title: Good sushi.
data.text: Visited here with my daughter and son in law who were here from Sarasota. The sushi was good and fresh. The restaurant itself could really use some upgrades though. It's a little run down and apparently the air wasn't working very well. We sat next to an oscillating fan and our poor waiter was visibly sweating. But the food was good and that's what is most important.

data.title: Great food
data.text:
One of the best Panang Curries I have had! 
Nice atmosphere... Luncheon prices are reasonable and large portions.

data.title: Best Shushi in the Cape
data.text: Best sushi I have ever had, hands down.  Prices are a little high, but the quality of sushi is wonderful!!

data.title: family owned, very good sushi and service.
data.text: A little run down as far as furniture and decor, but this place turns out very good sushi and friendly service. Have never been disappointed. fresh and very large rolls!

data.title: Really disappointing!
data.text:
After really enjoying sushi at a Fort Myers restaurant, I decided to try this place which had many good reviews online and was closer to home.  I went for lunch with a friend and ordered their "pick 3 rolls" special which was really reasonable at $12.95!

Unfortunately, I didn't really enjoy it.  The table was dirty which immediately put me off, and two of the three rolls I had ordered tasted as if they had been made the day before!  There was a sizable crowd so maybe I caught them on an off day!  I will say though that their sesame salad dressing was amazing!

data.title: Very good sushi
data.text: After being treated like dirt at Sakura, we tried here for takeout.  It was the best sushi we've had in the Cape.  I really enjoyed it - fresh and a huge selection.  I am only knocking off a star because it's very expensive.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Food is outstanding and fresh. Good for lunch. Restaurant for dinner not well equipped and to old. I am going there every week since almost 3 years for lunch . Great outside area but owner dont care about it. Buy new tables and chairs for outside and open up the umbrellas and more people will stop by. Service is ok but not great.
